title: How to Make Seasoned Pepper

steps.headline: Place all of the ingredients into a mixing bowl.
Tip into a storage container.
steps.description: An airtight glass spice bottle is a great choice.

steps.headline: Use as needed.
steps.description: Add to dishes to spice them up. Use within 3 to 6 months, for the best flavor.

steps.headline: Wash the lemons to remove grime.
steps.description: Peel the lemons with a microplane or zester.

steps.headline: Spread the peel pieces across a baking sheet.
steps.description: Place in the oven, middle rack, and heat at the lowest level it has.

steps.headline: Bake at this low temperature until the zest feels dry when you touch it.
steps.description: Check the dryness every half hour or so.

steps.headline: Crack the peppercorns using a pepper mill, grinder or mortar and pestle.
Grind or powder 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of dried lemon zest.
steps.description: Use the grinder or mortar. Don't make it too powdered; it needs to have some texture.

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients together.
steps.description: Add the cracked black pepper, ground lemon zest, sea salt, granulated or powdered garlic and onion powder to a mixing bowl. Stir to combine.

steps.headline: Transfer to a shaker container.
steps.description: Store airtight. Use within 3 to 6 months.

steps.headline: Add the ingredients to a blender or food processor.
Blend or process into a coarse powder.
Transfer to an airtight container with a sprinkle lid.

tyn: Glass spice container with airtight lid or similar storage container
Pepper mill, grinder or mortar and pestle
